meta.name: description
meta.content: The 100 (Continue) HTTP status signals a client to finish writing its request message.

main.p: The 100 Continue status code is a 1xx intermediate status code instructing the client to resume transmission of the rest of the request message. It is primarially seen in a request with Expect: 100-continue, where the client will transmit just the message headers, and wait for a 100 Continue intermediate status before uploading the message body.
This status code is used when handling requests with Expect: 100-continue, see the Expect header for usage.
If the client has sent a request with Expect: 100-continue, then upon reciept of 100 Continue, begin writing the request message-body. Otherwise, this intermediate status be ignored.

dd.a: RFC 7231: HTTP/1.1 Semantics and Content §6.2.1. 100 Continue

main.p: Node.js has sufficient support for 100 to process to process 100-continue expectations. These requests will be emitted as a separate event, see Event: 'checkContinue' and response.writeContinue() for server support; and Event: 'continue' for client support.
